title: Formation of Ruddlesden-Popper Faults in Complex Perovskite Oxides
content: Perovskite oxides, ABO3, are a class of materials showcasing unique properties due to the presence of three elements in the structure. Its stoichiometric flexibility allows it to host a variety of defects. Structural faults like Ruddlesden-Popper, elastic distortions, and BX3 octahedral tilts are commonly observed in these crystals and have been studied for their properties [1-2]. However, it is still not well understood how these defects form in the material. In order to synthesize perovskite oxide with controlled density of defects, in-depth understanding of their formation is necessary. In this study, we discuss possible routes of formation of Ruddlesden-Popper faults including through conventional 1D topological line defects.
